public Rectangle getMinimumDisplayRect(int availWidth)
Description copied from interface: Item
Returns the minimum dimensions that this Item requires for visible display of its contents. A rectangle with a zero dimension implies no minimum limit in that dimension.

Specified by:
getMinimumDisplayRect in interface Item
Parameters:

isFocusible

public boolean isFocusible()
Description copied from interface: Item
Checks whether this Item can be set as the currently focused Item. This means that this Item should be able to adjust its behavior or look and feel in response to calls to its focusGained() or focusLost() methods

Specified by:
isFocusible in interface Item
Returns:
true if can be focused and false otherwise

add

public void add(Item item)
Adds an item to this grid. The items are added to the Grid one row at a time until the row gets full when the addition progresses to the next row and so on.

Parameters:
item - the Item to be added to this Grid

remove

public void remove(int row,
                   int col)
Removes the item at the specified row and column from this Grid. The items in the Grid are repackaged to fill in the topmost rows of the Grid. Rows start at index zero and progress to row-count-1 as well as the columns

Parameters:
row - the row from which to delete a cmponent
col - the column from which to delete an item

keyPressedEvent

public void keyPressedEvent(int keyCode)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked when a key is pressed when this Item is in focus. This method performs the necessary action for the key pressed.

Specified by:
keyPressedEvent in interface Item
Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

keyPressedEventReturned

public void keyPressedEventReturned(int keyCode)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a keyPressed event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it.

Specified by:
keyPressedEventReturned in interface Item
Parameters:
keyCode - the key code as provided by the underlying native platform.

paint

public void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                  Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Paints the region of this Item specified by the clip. The Item makes calculations to reduce as much as possible the area that is repainted for the Item. If the clip does not intersect in any way with this Items displayRectangle, then the Item is not painted at all.

Specified by:
paint in interface Item
Parameters:
g - the graphics on which the painting is to be done
clip - the region of the graphics that requires update or that is to be painted on by this Item

pointerDraggedEvent

public void pointerDraggedEvent(int x,
                                int y)
Description copied from interface: Item
Called in a device that supports a pointer. This method provides the location information for the pointer when it is dragged. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Specified by:
pointerDraggedEvent in interface Item
Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerDraggedEventReturned

public void pointerDraggedEventReturned(int x,
                                        int y)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerDragged event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application and not this Item. To know whether the coordinate falls within its displayRect it can call the Rectangle.contains() method with the coordinates as the parameters.

Specified by:
pointerDraggedEventReturned in interface Item
Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer
See Also:
Item.getDisplayRect()

repaint

public void repaint(Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Repaints the given region of this Item. Mostly all calls to this method will result in the propagation of the call to the parent of this Item until the bottom most Item is reached so that all Items whose displayRectanges are intersected by the repainted rectangles repaints the intersects as well

Specified by:
repaint in interface Item
Parameters:
clip - the clip region that is to be repainted

setDisplayRect

public void setDisplayRect(Rectangle rect)
Description copied from interface: Item
Sets the rectangle that is available on the display for the rendering of this component

Specified by:
setDisplayRect in interface Item
Parameters:
rect - the Rectangle area available on the display for rendering of this Item

setFocusible

public void setFocusible(boolean focusible)
Description copied from interface: Item
Sets whether this Item should be focusable. This if passed the value true, then this Item will change its effects when being drawn to respond to focus gain and focus loss events

Specified by:
setFocusible in interface Item
See Also:
Item.focusGained(), Item.focusLost()

setPaintBorder

public void setPaintBorder(boolean paint)
Description copied from interface: Item
Used to specify whether this Item should paint its border or not. If set true the Item will paint its border and not otherwise. All borders are painted one pixel wide and might be rounded at the edges depending on the Style settings of the application

Specified by:
setPaintBorder in interface Item
Parameters:
paint - sets whether this Item should paint its border.

setParent

public void setParent(Item parent)
Description copied from interface: Item
Sets the parent for this Item which also have to be an Item. This reference to the parent will be used to provide features most of which is the scrolling callback to notify the parent container of a scrolling action.

Specified by:
setParent in interface Item
Parameters:
parent - the Item in which this Item is placed. null if this Item is the topmost Item

setPaintGrid

public void setPaintGrid(boolean paintGrid)
Sets whether this grid should paint the lines that mark its grid

Parameters:
paintGrid - true to paint the grid and false otherwise

isPaintGrid

public boolean isPaintGrid()
Checks whether this Grid is painting its grid lines

Returns:
true if repainting and false otherwise
